markdownRemark.html:
On morning in the fall of 2010, I left the dorm and biked my shaggy-headed self to the local barber. He charged me $10.00 for a simple haircut with the clippers, and I left a two-dollars tip.

I know realize that $12.00 is a bargain for a haircut, but my college budget wouldn’t allow it. As I stepped out of the door and felt the cool breeze across my freshly shorn head, I thought to myself:

I’m never going to pay for a haircut again.

That was eight years ago now, and I haven’t—to the best of my recollection—been to the barber since. (I had planned to go before my wedding but put it off too long and wound up cutting it myself the day before.)
